wikipedia_page.main: Rosemary Bailey (born 1953) is a British writer. She writes travel memoirs about France. In 2008 Bailey won the British Guild of Travel Writers' award for best narrative travel book, Love and War in the Pyrenees.

response: Miles also produced Ginsberg's Songs of Innocence and Experience LP, recorded in 1969 and released the following year. In 1970, Miles moved with his wife to rural New York state, where he lived with Ginsberg on his farm.  However, Miles's marriage soon ended and he returned to England. Miles currently lives in London and is married to travel writer Rosemary Bailey.Rosemary Bailey website http://www.rosemarybailey.com/

Simon Bailey became well known to a wider public as a result of a BBC Everyman documentary programme, Simon's Cross, which was broadcast on 15 January 1995. His sister Rosemary Bailey wrote a lengthy article for the Independent on Sunday ("A Parish Learns to be Positive"), which was published on the same day. The making of the programme led to Rosemary writing the biography, Scarlet Ribbons: A Priest with AIDS. AIDS BOOK REVIEW JOURNAL A new edition was published in 2017 to considerable acclaim including the BBC Radio 4 broadcast A priest with AIDS on 23 July 2017.
*Rosemary Bailey, The Man Who Married a Mountain, Bantam Books, 2005,

link_mentions.page: Scarlet Ribbons: A Priest with AIDS
response: Scarlet Ribbons: A Priest with AIDS is a biography written by Rosemary Bailey about the life of her brother, Simon Bailey who was an Anglican priest and writer.

on 15 January 1995. After the broadcast his sister, Rosemary Bailey wrote an article for The Independent called A Parish Learns to be Positive. Subsequently after the documentary and article Rosemary Bailey wrote her brother's biography, Scarlet Ribbons: A Priest with AIDS.

link_mentions.page: Love and War in the Pyrenees
response: Love and War in the Pyrenees is a book written by Rosemary Bailey. Bailey in 2008. The book was awarded the best narrative travel book by the British Guild of Travel Writers.

The bookLove and War in the Pyrenees, Weidenfeld & Nicolson, 2008 is about  World War II in the Pyrenees region.Camp de Rivesaltes, Pyrénées-Orientales, South of France Rebecca Abrams from The Jewish Chronicle described the book as "a quiet triumph of historical reconstruction."Love and War In The Pyrenees by Rosemary Bailey The Jewish Chronicle, Friday, 12 September  2008.
